instruction: Talk about a famous leader who changed the world.
output: Nelson Mandela is a famous leader who changed the world. He served as the President of South Africa from 1994 to 1999, and was a leading figure in the anti-apartheid and civil rights movements. He was instrumental in dismantling the country's oppressive laws, including segregation laws and other apartheid policies. During his time as President, Mandela pushed for reconciliation between the oppressors and oppressed, as well as advocating for the rights of indigenous people and other minority groups. His legacy has been to inspire generations of people to fight for justice, equality and freedom.
